intro: Hypodematium glandulosopilosum, commonly known as the sticky-hair hypodematium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
